title: PEcAn Functions Used for Benchmarking
text: can install development version PEcAn.benchmark r-universe like : can install directly GitHub remotes package like :
code: # Enable repository from pecanproject options(repos = c(   pecanproject = 'https://pecanproject.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) # Download and install PEcAn.benchmark in R install.packages('PEcAn.benchmark') library(remotes) install_github('pecanproject/pecan',  subdir = "modules/benchmark")

align_first_observation — align_by_first_observation
text: observation_one vector plant functional types, species. Provides species/pft names. observation_two another vector plant functional types, species. Provides order. custom_table table either maps two pft's one another maps custom species codes bety id codes. second case, must passable match_species_id.

title: align_first_observation — align_by_first_observation
text: vector Returns vector PFT's/species observation_one matches order observation_two

title: align_first_observation — align_by_first_observation
code: observation_one<-c("AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3") observation_two<-c("a", "b", "a", "a")  table<-list() table$plant_functional_type_one<- c("AMCA3","AMCA3","ARHY", "ARHY") table$plant_functional_type_two<- c('a','a','b', 'b') # PFT groupings table<-as.data.frame(table)  aligned <- align_by_first_observation(   observation_one = observation_one,   observation_two = observation_two,   custom_table = table) #> Warning: number of items to replace is not a multiple of replacement length #> Warning: number of items to replace is not a multiple of replacement length #> Warning: number of items to replace is not a multiple of replacement length #> Warning: number of items to replace is not a multiple of replacement length  # aligned should be a vector '[1] "AMCA3" "ARHY"  "AMCA3" "AMCA3"'

title: Align timeseries data — align_data
text: model.calc data.frame obvs.calc data.frame var data.frame align_method name function use alignment

title: align_data_to_data_pft — align_data_to_data_pft
code: align_data_to_data_pft(   con,   observation_one,   observation_two,   custom_table = NULL,   format_one,   format_two,   subset_is_ok = FALSE )

title: align_data_to_data_pft — align_data_to_data_pft
text: con database connection observation_one vector plant functional types, species observation_two another vector plant functional types, species custom_table table either maps two pft's one another maps custom species codes bety id codes. second case, must passable match_species_id. format_one output query.format.vars() observation one form output$vars$bety_names format_two output query.format.vars() observation two form output$vars$bety_names subset_is_ok aligning two species lists, allows alignment species lists identical. set FALSE default.

title: align_data_to_data_pft — align_data_to_data_pft
text: list containing following columns: $original spit back original vectors pre-alignment $aligned$aligned_by_observation_one possible, return vector observation_one pft's/species order observation_two species possible, return vector observation_two's pft's/species order observation_one $bety_species_id possible, return bety_species_id's one observations $bety_species_intersection possible, return intersection two aligned lists species. subset_is_ok must set TRUE.

title: align_data_to_data_pft — align_data_to_data_pft
text: Aligns vectors Plant Fucntional Typed species. Can align: - two vectors plant functional types (pft's) custom map provided - list species (usda, fia, latin_name format) plant functional type - list species custom format, table mapping bety_species_id's return list originally provided, bety_species_codes possible,  aligned output. alignement order-sensitive, alignment based observation_one  observation_two provided.

title: align_data_to_data_pft — align_data_to_data_pft
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  observation_one<-c("AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3") observation_two<-c("a", "b", "a", "a")  table<-list() table$plant_functional_type_one<- c("AMCA3","AMCA3","ARHY", "ARHY") table$plant_functional_type_two<- c('a','a','b', 'b') # PFT groupings table<-as.data.frame(table)  format_one<-"species_USDA_symbol" format_two<-"plant_functional_type"  aligned <- align_data_to_data_pft(  con = con,  observation_one = observation_one, observation_two = observation_two,  format_one = format_one, format_two = format_two,  custom_table = table) } # }

code: align_pft(   con,   observation_one,   observation_two,   custom_table = NULL,   format_one,   format_two,   subset_is_ok = FALSE,   comparison_type = "data_to_data",   ... )

title: Align vectors of Plant Functional Type and species. — align_pft
text: con database connection observation_one vector plant fucntional types, species observation_two anouther vector plant fucntional types, species custom_table table either maps two pft's one anouther maps custom species codes bety id codes. second case, must passable match_species_id. format_one output query.format.vars() observation one form output$vars$bety_names format_two output query.format.vars() observation two form output$vars$bety_names subset_is_ok aligning two species lists, allows alignement species lists identical. set FALSE default. comparison_type one "data_to_model", "data_to_data", "model_to_model" ... arguments, currently ignored

title: Align vectors of Plant Functional Type and species. — align_pft
text: list containing following columns: $original spit back original vectors pre-alignment $aligned$aligned_by_observation_one possible, return vector observation_one pft's/species order observation_two species possible, return vector observation_two's pft's/species order observation_one $bety_species_id possible, return bety_species_id's one observations

title: Align vectors of Plant Functional Type and species. — align_pft
text: Can align: - two vectors plant fucntional types (pft's) custom map provided - list species (usda, fia, latin_name format) plant fucntional type - list species custom format, table mapping bety_species_id's return list originally provided, bety_speceis_codes possible,  aligned output. Becuase alignement order-sensitive, alignment based observation_one  observation_two provided. comparison_type can one following: data_to_data align lists pfts species. Must assosiated inputs. data_to_model yet implemented model_to_model yet implemented

title: Align vectors of Plant Functional Type and species. — align_pft
Align vectors of Plant Functional Type and species. — align_pft
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   #------------ A species to PFT alignment ----------- observation_one<-c("AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3","AMCA3") observation_two<-c("a", "b", "a", "a") #  format_one<-"species_USDA_symbol" format_two<-"plant_funtional_type"  table<-list() table$plant_functional_type_one<- c("AMCA3","AMCA3","ARHY", "ARHY") table$plant_functional_type_two<- c('a','a','b', 'b') # PFT groupings table<-as.data.frame(table)   aligned<-align_pft(con = con, observation_one = observation_one, observation_two = observation_two,  format_one = format_one, format_two = format_two, custom_table = table) } # }
